sense.name: unexpected development or event
sense.examples: They would never have met except for a simple twist of fate. Events have taken a strange twist in recent weeks. His political campaign survived many twists and turns. There is a silly twist at the end of the movie where the villain repents and gives away all his money.

sense.name: an interpretation or spin in meaning
sense.examples: This fall's couture is a twist on styles from the late 60s. Her biography presents an interesting twist on the painter's personal life.

sense.name: the act of turning, rotating an object
sense.commentary: TWIST[+event][+turning][+rotating][+an_object] Note: implies the act of displacing an object by turning it
sense.examples: A single clockwise twist will open the tap. She pulled free from her assailant with a sudden twist of her body. With a twist of his wrist he opened the pickle jar.

sense.name: the force or torque that produces a turning motion
sense.examples: The transmission amplifies or multiplies the twist coming from the engine by a factor equal to the gear ratio. The torque or twist equals the distance times the weight. The horsepower of the engine = twist x engine speed / 5,252.

sense.name: a wrench or pull in a muscle
sense.examples: John was on crutches from a nasty twist of his ankle. A soak in a hot tub eased the twist in Sally's lower back.

sense.name: bend or loop in a flexible rope or line
sense.examples: A bowline has clever twists that allow the knot to take load, but also be easily untied. The bartender garnished the martini with a twist of lemon. (flexible strip of peel) A twist in the garden hose is keeping the water from flowing.

sense.name: curve or bend in a path
sense.examples: The sign on the road warned of twists and turns for the next 60 miles. The village was built along a twist in the river where it turned westward towards the sea.

sense.name: a miniature whirlpool
sense.examples: We steered the canoe carefully through twists and eddies of the river. There is a dangerous twist in the river caused by the intermingling of two currents.

sense.name: rolled up hairdo style
sense.examples: The bride wore her hair in a twist, decorated with small white flowers. Mary showed me how to put my hair up in a French twist.

sense.name: social dance with gyrating hips
sense.examples: In the 1960s, the twist was a very popular dance. They practiced the rhumba, the tango, the cha-cha and the twist in dance class.
